H0.text: Hail is the form of precipitation most likely to cause damage when hitting the roof of a car.

H1.text: Rain is the form of precipitation most likely to cause damage when hitting the roof of a car.

H2.text: Sleet is the form of precipitation most likely to cause damage when hitting the roof of a car.

H3.text: Snow is the form of precipitation most likely to cause damage when it hits the roof of a car.

A4.text: Hail is a common nuisance to drivers of automobiles, severely denting the vehicle and cracking or even shattering windshields and windows unless parked in a garage or covered with a shielding material.
